name: San Francisco Sourdough Bread Pudding with Amaretto Sauce
author: slfortson
summary: After trying numerous bread pudding recipes, I attempted to create my own, using flavors that I love. The sourdough adds to the recipe without being overwhelming, and the amaretto brings a light almond flavoring to the top. My family enjoys it, and I hope you do as well.
ingredients: 6 thick slices sourdough bread, crusts removed and cut into small cubes
directions: Place bread cubes in a 9x13-inch baking dish
Combine milk, eggs, sugar, butter, vanilla extract, and cinnamon in a mixing bowl
Pour mixture over bread and let sit for about 30 minutes to let bread absorb and soften
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Bake in the preheated oven until top is lightly browned, about 50 minutes
Melt 1 stick butter in a saucepan over low heat, 3 to 5 minutes
Add confectioners' sugar and stir well
Allow sauce to sit at room temperature until thickened, about 15 minutes
Pour sauce over bread pudding before serving
